Pre-Game Insights: Ireland will play their third game of the T20 World Cup 2024 against United States of America on Friday in Florida.
Paul Stirling and his team have a huge mountain to climb if they have to make it to the Super 8 stages.
Ireland’s bad starts to the innings have cost them dear, with Andrew Balbirnie and Paul Stirling struggling for runs.
Ireland’s lead pacer Joshua Little can find his form in the game against USA.
Mark Adair has been impressing everyone with his steady bowling and is also more than capable with the bat.
Barry McCarthy and Craig Young have been putting up consistent performances and delivering wickets at regular intervals for their side.
